security_audit.summary: This skill creates Git branches for SDD workflows using standard git commands. User confirmation is required before execution. All static findings are false positives from documentation examples being misidentified as code execution.

content.user_title: Create Git Branches for SDD Workflows
content.value_statement: Automate branch creation in spec-driven development. Create properly named spec and impl branches with user confirmation and error handling.
actual_capabilities: Creates spec branches for specification tasks
Creates impl branches for implementation tasks
Checks for existing branches before creation
Handles uncommitted changes with multiple options
Requires user confirmation before branch creation
limitations: Only supports spec and impl branch types
Requires git repository to be present
Cannot create branches without user confirmation
Limited to main branch as base

use_cases.title: SDD Specification Branches
use_cases.description: Create spec branches when starting new feature specifications in spec-driven development workflow.

use_cases.title: Implementation Branch Management
use_cases.description: Generate impl branches for development tasks with consistent naming across the team.

use_cases.title: Workflow Automation
use_cases.description: Integrate with spec-workflow skill for automated branch creation during SDD processes.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /branch within spec-workflow for automatic branch creation

output: Display success message with new branch name

best_practices: Always confirm branch creation before proceeding
Use descriptive action IDs that follow your team conventions
Ensure you are on the correct base branch before creating new branches
Handle existing branches by switching or creating with different names
anti_patterns: Ignoring uncommitted changes when switching branches
Creating branches from non-main branches without consideration

faq.question: What branch types does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports two branch types: spec for specification tasks and impl for implementation tasks in SDD workflow.

faq.question: Can I create branches without confirmation?
faq.answer: No, user confirmation is required for all branch creations to prevent accidental branch creation.

faq.question: What happens if the branch already exists?
faq.answer: The skill will prompt you to either switch to the existing branch, create with a different name, or delete and recreate.

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with other Git workflows?
faq.answer: The skill is designed specifically for SDD workflows but can be used in any Git repository.

faq.question: How does it handle uncommitted changes?
faq.answer: The skill detects uncommitted changes and offers options to stash, commit, or discard them before creating the new branch.

faq.question: Can I customize the branch naming convention?
faq.answer: The skill follows a fixed naming pattern of type/action-id-description to ensure consistency across SDD workflows.
